what: Clone a project from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — clone.project
title: Clone a project from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — clone.project
text: Creates copy RDR project folder specified location. Remote users must connected one Service’s approved remote connection technologies, Virtual Private Network (VPN).

title: Clone a project from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — clone.project
Clone a project from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — clone.project
text: project Character string. Name project folder. path Character string. Directory path cloned project located. Default working directory, getwd(). main Logical. Whether return results main project folder (subfolders except "incoming"). Default TRUE. incoming Logical. Whether return results "incoming" project subfolder. Default TRUE.

title: Clone a project from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — clone.project
text: Returns download project folder contents.

title: Clone a project from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — clone.project
code: # clone.project(project = "mbmlb_010_Grey_headed_chickadee_hybridization", path = getwd(), main = TRUE, incoming = TRUE)

title: Commit files to the
text: Copies local file(s) "incoming" subfolder specified RDR project updates changelog document changes. Remote users must connected Service’s approved remote connection technologies, Virtual Private Network (VPN) granted write permission project’s “incoming" subfolder (.e., authorized "data steward").

title: Commit files to the
Commit files to the
text: project Character string. Name project folder. local.folder Character string. Directory name path uncommitted files located. Default working directory, getwd(). recursive Logical. Whether search commit files subdirectories. Default TRUE.

title: Commit files to the
text: Returns vector committed files.

title: Commit files to the
code: # e.g.commit<- commit.files(project = "mbmlb_010_Grey_headed_chickadee_hybridization", local.folder = getwd(), recursive = TRUE)

what: Download project file(s) from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — download.files
title: Download project file(s) from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — download.files
text: Searches file name patterns specified RDR project folder downloads matching files. Remote users must connected one Service’s approved remote connection technologies, Virtual Private Network (VPN).

title: Download project file(s) from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — download.files
code: download.files(   pattern,   project,   path,   main,   incoming,   recursive,   download.file.method )

title: Download project file(s) from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — download.files
text: pattern Character vector. File name pattern(s). Must regular expression; print ?base::regex help. Default NULL, allows selection files. project Character string. Name project folder. path Character string. Directory path downloaded files saved. Default working directory, getwd(). main Logical. Whether return results main project folder (subfolders except "incoming"). Default TRUE. incoming Logical. Whether return results "incoming" project subfolder. Default TRUE. recursive Logical. Whether search download files subdirectories. Default TRUE. download.file.method Character string. Method used downloading files. Print ?options available methods. Default "auto".

title: Download project file(s) from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — download.files
text: Returns file download(s) match search criteria.

title: Download project file(s) from the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — download.files
code: # download.files(pattern = c("template","dictionary","\.csv","hello"), project = "mbmlb_007_NWR_Alaska_Landbird_Monitoring_Survey", path = getwd(), incoming = TRUE, main = TRUE, recursive = TRUE, download.file.method = "curl")

what: Find the location(s) of project file(s) on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.files
title: Find the location(s) of project file(s) on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.files
text: Finds data file(s) specified RDR project folder. Remote users must connected one Service’s approved remote connection technologies, Virtual Private Network (VPN).

title: Find the location(s) of project file(s) on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.files
code: find.files(pattern, project, main, incoming, recursive, full.path)

title: Find the location(s) of project file(s) on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.files
text: pattern Character vector. File name pattern(s). Must regular expression; print ?base::regex help. Default NULL, returns results files. project Character string. Name project folder. main Logical. Whether return results main project folder (subfolders except "incoming"). Default TRUE. incoming Logical. whether return results "incoming" project subfolder. Default TRUE. recursive Logical. Whether search files subdirectories. Default TRUE. full.path Logical. Whether return full file path. Default FALSE

title: Find the location(s) of project file(s) on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.files
text: Returns vector paths files match search criteria.

title: Find the location(s) of project file(s) on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — find.files
code: # e.g.file.locs<- find.files(pattern = c("template","dictionary","\.csv","hello"), project = "mbmlb_007_NWR_Alaska_Landbird_Monitoring_Survey", incoming = TRUE, main = FALSE, recursive = TRUE, full.path = FALSE)

what: Copy the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) project directory tree template. — get.dir.template
title: Copy the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) project directory tree template. — get.dir.template
text: Creates RDR project folder structure specified location.

title: Copy the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) project directory tree template. — get.dir.template
code: get.dir.template(project, path, main = TRUE, incoming = TRUE)

title: Copy the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) project directory tree template. — get.dir.template
text: project Character string. Name project folder. path Character string. Directory path project located. Default working directory, getwd(). main Logical. Whether include main project folder (subfolders except "incoming"). Default TRUE. incoming Logical. Whether include "incoming" project subfolder. Default TRUE

title: Copy the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) project directory tree template. — get.dir.template
text: Returns download project directory tree template.

title: Copy the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) project directory tree template. — get.dir.template
code: # get.dir.template(project = "mbmlb_909_Eskimo_Curlew_study", path = getwd(), main = TRUE, incoming = TRUE)

what: Read a tabular project file on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) into R — read.tables
title: Read a tabular project file on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) into R — read.tables
text: Reads tabular data file(s) specified RDR project folder. Remote users must connected one Service’s approved remote connection technologies, Virtual Private Network (VPN).

title: Read a tabular project file on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) into R — read.tables
Read a tabular project file on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) into R — read.tables
text: pattern Character vector. File name pattern(s). Must regular expression; print ?base::regex help. Default NULL, allows selection files. project Character string. Name project folder. main Logical. Whether return results main project folder (subfolders except "incoming"). Default TRUE. incoming Logical. Whether return results "incoming" project subfolder. Default TRUE. recursive Logical. Whether search read files subdirectories. Default TRUE.

title: Read a tabular project file on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) into R — read.tables
text: Returns data frame one selected tabular data files.

title: Read a tabular project file on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) into R — read.tables
code: # e.g.tabular.data<- read.tables(pattern = c("\.csv","\.xlsx"), project = "mbmlb_007_NWR_Alaska_Landbird_Monitoring_Survey", incoming = TRUE, main = TRUE, recursive = TRUE)

what: Summarize project files on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — summarize.files
title: Summarize project files on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — summarize.files
text: Summarizes files specified RDR project folder. Remote users must connected one Service’s approved remote connection technologies, Virtual Private Network (VPN).

title: Summarize project files on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — summarize.files
code: summarize.files(   project,   subfolder = NULL,   main = TRUE,   incoming = TRUE,   recursive = TRUE )

title: Summarize project files on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — summarize.files
text: project Character string. Name project folder. subfolder Optional character vector. Name(s) subfolder(s) summarize. Default NULL, returns results subfolders. main Logical. Whether return results main project folder (subfolders except incoming). Default TRUE. incoming Logical. Whether return results "incoming" project subfolder. Default TRUE. recursive Logical. Whether search files subdirectories. Default TRUE.

title: Summarize project files on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — summarize.files
text: Returns data frame summarizing subfolder contents.

title: Summarize project files on the USFWS Alaska Regional Data Repository (RDR) — summarize.files
code: # e.g.summary<- summarize.files(project = "mbmlb_007_NWR_Alaska_Landbird_Monitoring_Survey", subfolder = c("/", "final_data", "metadata"), incoming = TRUE, main = FALSE, recursive = TRUE)
